originalTitle: At least 55 Ghanaians killed in Russia-Ukraine war, minister says
title: At least 55 Ghanaians killed in Russia-Ukraine war, minister says
content: This is the highest number of confirmed casualties from a single African country in the Ukraine-Russia war.

originalTitle: Former US diplomat sentenced to life for abusing two girls in Burkina Faso
title: Keeping Kids Safe: A Story of Justice in Africa!
content:
Hello, my wonderful friends! I'm your friendly news reporter, here to share important news from our beautiful continent of Africa. Today, we have a story that might sound a little bit serious, but it has a very important message for all children: you are special, and you deserve to be safe, always! Sometimes, grown-ups do very bad things. But it's also true that there are many, many good grown-ups who work hard to keep you safe. This story is about how good people help to make things right when someone does something wrong.

What Happened in a Country Called Burkina Faso?

Let's travel to a country in Africa called Burkina Faso. It's a place with lovely people, just like where you live. In Burkina Faso, there was a man who came from another country, America. He worked there, helping his country. This man was called a diplomat. A diplomat is like a special helper who works for their country in another country. Their job is usually to build good relationships and help people. But this man did something very, very wrong. He hurt two young girls. He did things that made them feel scared and sad. This is not okay, ever. Grown-ups are supposed to protect children, not hurt them. Did you know? Burkina Faso is a country in West Africa. Its name means 'Land of Upright People'. Isn't that a lovely name? It reminds us that people should always do the right thing.

What is a Diplomat?

A diplomat is someone who represents their own country in a foreign country. Think of it like a special messenger or a team player for their home country. They work in places like embassies. An embassy is like a small office building for their country in another land. They help people from their country and talk with the leaders of the new country. Usually, diplomats do good things. They help people understand each other and work together. But sometimes, even people with important jobs can make very bad choices.

When Someone Does Something Wrong

When a grown-up does something very wrong, especially to children, it is a very serious problem. There are special rules and laws to make sure everyone is safe. These rules are for all people, no matter how important their job is. Brave people, like police officers and other helpers, work very hard to find out what happened. They listen carefully to everyone and gather all the facts. They want to make sure the truth comes out. This is a very important part of keeping communities safe. When someone breaks the rules and hurts others, they need to be stopped. And they need to face the results of their actions. Did you know? In many African countries, people work together in their communities to keep children safe. It's like a big family looking out for each other!

Justice for the Girls

In this story, the bad man was caught. That is good news! After a lot of careful work, a special person called a judge listened to everything. A judge is like a very wise grown-up who helps decide what should happen when someone does something wrong. They make sure that the rules are followed fairly for everyone. The judge listened to all the information. The judge knew that the man had done very bad, harmful things to the two young girls. This was not right, and it was against the law. So, the judge decided that the man should go to prison for a very, very long time. This is called a 'life sentence.' It means he will stay in prison for the rest of his life, or for a very, very long time. This is called 'justice.' Justice means making things right. It means that if someone hurts others, they will be stopped, and they will be punished. It helps protect other children from getting hurt in the future.

Who Can Help You Stay Safe?

This is the most important part of our news today, my friends. You are safe, and there are many good grown-ups who love you and want to protect you. These are your 'trusted adults.' A trusted adult is someone you feel safe with. It could be your mother, father, grandparent, teacher, auntie, uncle, or a kind older family friend. They are the people who always listen to you and believe you. If anyone, no matter who they are, ever makes you feel uncomfortable, scared, or sad, you must tell a trusted adult. Even if someone tells you to keep it a secret, you must tell. No secret is too big to tell a trusted adult. Did you know? Speaking up is a superpower! When you tell a trusted adult that something is wrong, you are being very brave. You are helping to keep yourself and others safe.

Did You Know? Your Body Is Yours!

Your body belongs to you. No one has the right to touch your body in a way that makes you feel bad, uncomfortable, or scared. You have the power to say 'NO!' If someone tries to touch you in a way you don't like, or asks you to do something that feels wrong, you can say NO very loudly. You can run away. And then, you must tell a trusted adult right away. Remember, it is never, ever your fault if a grown-up does something bad to you. The grown-up is the one who did wrong, not you.

What We Learn From This Story

This story from Burkina Faso teaches us a lot. It teaches us that bad people exist, but they can be caught and stopped. It teaches us that justice works to keep people safe. Most importantly, it teaches us that you are important. Your feelings are important. Your safety is important. And there are always good people who will help you. So, my dear friends, remember to always be brave, always speak up, and always tell a trusted adult if anything or anyone makes you feel unsafe. You are loved, and you are protected. Keep safe, keep smiling, and keep learning! This is your friendly African news reporter, signing off for now.
summary: A bad grown-up who hurt two young girls in Burkina Faso has been caught and will go to prison for a very long time, showing that justice helps keep children safe.
whyMatters: This story is important because it shows that grown-ups who do bad things to children get punished, and that there are always good adults who will help keep you safe if you tell them when something feels wrong.

originalTitle: South Africa beat Zimbabwe to set up NZ semi-final
title: South Africa beat Zimbabwe to set up NZ semi-final
content: South Africa produce an unconvincing performance with the bat as they beat Zimbabwe by five wickets to set up a semi-final against New Zealand

title: US confirms three soldiers killed in Iran attacks

title: Missile strikes continue as Iranian leaders project defiance after Khamenei
content: Strikes keep hitting Tehran, but Iran's surviving leaders are closing ranks and vowing revenge.

title: Iran after Ayatollah Ali Khamenei
content: Proponents of foreign intervention in Iran are unlikely to get the sudden rupture and regime change they hope for.

originalTitle: Iran's regime is still intact - the coming days will show if it can hold out
title: Iran's regime is still intact - the coming days will show if it can hold out
content: Iran's surviving leaders are in crisis mode, battling to project security as US and Israel strikes continue.

originalTitle: At least 153 dead after reported strike on school, Iran says
title: At least 153 dead after reported strike on school, Iran says
content: Iran has blamed the US and Israel for the strike; the US is looking into reports of the incident, while the IDF says it is "not aware" of operations in the area.

originalTitle: Nine dead in missile attack on Israel as Iran strikes region
title: Nine dead in missile attack on Israel as Iran strikes region
content: Several deaths are reported across the Middle East as Tehran retaliates for massive strikes by the US and Israel.

originalTitle: Arsenal beat 10-man Chelsea to extend lead
title: Arsenal beat 10-man Chelsea to extend lead
content: Arsenal get an important win in the title race against Chelsea, who had Pedro Neto sent off for a second yellow in a game with three goals scored from corners.

originalTitle: Sesko leads Man Utd to victory against 10-man Crystal Palace
title: Sesko leads Man Utd to victory against 10-man Crystal Palace
content: Benjamin Sesko scores his sixth goal in eight games to help Manchester United secure a comeback victory against Crystal Palace and move up to third in the Premier League.

originalTitle: Fulham sink struggling Spurs with incredible Iwobi goal
title: Fulham sink struggling Spurs with incredible Iwobi goal
content: Alex Iwobi scores a beautifully-placed goal as Fulham hold off late pressure from Tottenham Hotspur to win 2-1.
